official-title.#text:
To amend the Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation
		  Act of 1985 to authorize the Commissioner of U.S. Customs and Border Protection
		  to enter into reimbursable fee agreements for the provision of additional
		  services at Customs ports of entry, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Services to Allow New Destinations for
			 Tourism Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Reimbursable fee
			 agreements for provision of additional Customs services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is
			 amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 13031 of the
			 Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985/s:13031

header.#text:
Reimbursable fee
				agreements for provision of additional Customs services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may enter
				into an agreement with such person under which the person agrees to pay a fee
				to reimburse

for the provision of additional
				services and any other costs incurred by
relating to such services at Customs ports of entry.

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any other provision of law, and upon the
				request of any person requesting Customs services, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985/s:13031/ss:l

text.#text:
Funds collected pursuant to any agreement entered into
				under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: for the provision of

services and remain available until expended
				for the purposes described in

, without fiscal year limitation;
				and
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985/s:13031/ss:l/p:1

text.#text:
shall be credited
				to accounts that may be established by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
in providing
				additional Customs services and any other costs incurred by
relating to such services at Customs ports of entry.

text.#text:
shall be used to
				pay any expenses incurred by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to
				provide such Customs services and other costs incurred by

relating to such services at Customs ports of entry, such as
				temporary placement or permanent relocation of those individuals.

text.#text:
The amount of the fee to be charged pursuant to
				an agreement entered into under this subsection shall be paid by each person
				requesting additional Customs services and shall include the salary and
				expenses of individuals employed by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be deposited into 1 or more of the
				accounts established under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985/s:13031/ss:l/p:4

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and shall be available as described
				therein.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985/s:13031/ss:l/p:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, fails to pay such fee in a
				timely manner shall—

text.#text:
Any person who, after notice and demand for payment of any
				fee charged under

be guilty of a
				misdemeanor, and if convicted thereof shall pay a fine that does not exceed an
				amount equal to 200 percent of such fee in addition to court costs; and

be liable for a
				penalty or liquidated damage equal to 2 times the amount of the fee in addition
				to court costs.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: specifications.

text.#text:
Each facility at which such Customs
				services are performed shall provide, maintain, and equip, without cost to the
				Federal Government, such facilities in accordance with

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985/s:13031/ss:l

term.#tail:
means the Commissioner of U.S. Customs and Border
				Protection of the Department of Homeland Security; and

text.#text:
a corporation,
				partnership, trust, association, or any other public or private entity,
				including any foreign government or transit authority, or any officer,
				employee, or agent
				thereof.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985/s:13031/ss:l

quote.#text:
, or any agreement entered into
			 pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the
			 end before the period the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 13031(e)(2)(A) of the Consolidated Omnibus Budget
			 Reconciliation Act of 1985
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985/s:13031/ss:e/p:2/sp:A

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall take effect on October 1, 2013.
